You must have permission to enroll in-person.
(1st year through 4th year students) 
(Have you ever wondered how artists paint and create scenery for theater and film? Now you can learn. This semester will consist of 12 three-hour long in-person studio classes on Fridays with instruction in the foundations of scenic painting. Students will learn about light and color theory, layout, handling of paint and other scenic materials and methods of reproducing master paintings. In addition to the fundamental principles in this art form, students will be given more specific technical instruction in areas of architectural perspective, faux finishes, mastering large scale painting.)
course_description: Basic techniques of scenic painting in theater and film in step-by-step projects. The role of the scenic artist. How to communicate with a scenic designer. How to comment constructively on your own work and that of class mates.
